section.name: Power spectrum
section.definition: Properties of this section define the way a power spectrum was calculated.

property.name: Author
property.definition: The name of the person who did the analysis, e.g. 'John Doe' or 'Doe, John'

property.name: Description
property.definition: A general description of the analysis.

property.name: SegmentLength
property.definition: The length of the analysed data stretches. Given in samples.

property.name: WindowFunction
property.definition: The type of window used. E.g. Hamming, Hanning, etc.

property.name: Overlap

value.definition: The overlap between consecutive data segments. Given in percent of the SegmentLength.
The overlap between consecutive data segments given in samples.

property.definition: The overlap between consecutive data segments.

property.name: Method
property.definition: The name of a method used in this analysis. E.g. "power spectrum".

property.name: CommandlineCall
property.definition: The command used to execute the analysis including the command line parameter.

property.name: Code

value.definition: The program code to analyse the data can be transferred using this property. Using it will blow up the the size of the metadatafile and we recommend to rather define the URL of underlying code file.
The URL of the applied piece of program code to actually do the analysis.

property.definition: The program code used to analyze the data.

property.name: CodeRevision
property.definition: If the analysis code is under version control the revision number can be specified using this property.

property.name: ConfigFile

value.definition: The URL of the used configuration file used to run the analysis.

The configurations used to analyse the data can be transferred using this property. Using it will blow up the the size of the metadatafile and we recommend to rather define the URL of underlying configuration file.

property.definition: The configurations used to analyse the data.

value.definition: The data analysed ion the described way can be transferred using this property. Using it will blow up the the size of the metadatafile and we recommend to rather define the URL of underlying dataset file.
The URL of a analysed datasetFile.

property.name: ResultFile

value.definition: The results of this analysis can be transferred using this property. Using it will blow up the the size of the metadatafile and we recommend to rather define the URL of the results file.
The URL of a results file.

property.definition: A file containing the results of this analysis.

value.definition: This property is meant to store the real figure content. This will blow up the the size of the metadatafile and we recommend to rather define the URL of the figure.
The url of the results figure.

property.name: PaperDOI
property.definition: If the results of this analysis have been published one can store the doi of the paper.

property.name: PaperURL
property.definition: If the results of this analysis have been published the URL of the document can be given here
